bestBHT.bht: The protagonist in the parable has a sudden realization and is resolved to put the debtors under obligation to himself. He develops a plan for them to receive him into their homes and provide shelter, securing another home after being cast out of his current one. This parable sheds light on the repercussions of dishonesty and emphasizes the importance of choosing the path of honesty for comfort and peace.

Henry Alford: I am resolved: implying, I have just arrived at the knowledge,—an idea has just struck me,—I have a plan."
They may receive me—viz. those who are about to be spoken of, the debtors. He has them in his mind."
The aim of his scheme is that they may receive him into their houses,—give him shelter.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: his one object—when cast out of one home to secure another.
This is the key to the parable, on which there have been many differing views.
when cast out of one home to secure another.
Albert Barnes: Dishonesty will sooner or later lead us into difficulty, and that the path of honesty is not only the 'right' path, but is the path that is filled with most comfort and peace.
He had been dishonest to his master, and, having 'commenced' a course of dishonesty, he did not shrink from pursuing it.
He was resolved to lay these persons under such obligations, and to show them so much kindness, that they could not well refuse to return the kindness to him and give him a support.
Marvin Vincent: They may receive. The debtors of his master (ver. 5).
Archibald T. Robertson: I knew, I know, I have known, all miss it a bit."
I've got it, I see into it now, a sudden solution.
He wishes to put the debtors under obligation to himself.
John Gill: I am resolved what to do... I know what to do...
I have a scheme in my head, and I am determined to execute it...
...which will provide for me, and secure me a maintenance...
John Wesley: I know — That is, I am resolved, what to do.

bhtAttempts.bht: The protagonist in the parable of Luke 16:4 has a sudden realization and comes up with a plan. He wants the debtors to receive him and provide him with shelter, an act that will put them in his debt. He is determined to secure another home after being cast out of his current one. His aim is to lay these debtors under an obligation to himself, so that they will be more inclined to support him in return. This parable highlights the repercussions of dishonesty and the importance of choosing the path of honesty for comfort and peace.

In the parable, the protagonist arrives at a sudden realization and develops a plan. He wants the debtors to receive him and provide shelter, putting them under obligation to him. His sole objective is to secure another home after being cast out of his current one. This parable emphasizes the consequences of dishonesty and the significance of choosing the path of honesty for comfort and peace.

In the parable, the protagonist is resolved and has a sudden realization, leading him to develop a plan. His aim is for the debtors to receive him into their homes and give him shelter, thereby putting them in his debt. The main objective is to secure another home after being cast out of his current one. The parable highlights the consequences of dishonesty and the importance of choosing the path of honesty for comfort and peace.

This parable sheds light on the repercussions of dishonesty and emphasizes the importance of choosing the path of honesty for comfort and peace.

The main character of the parable has a sudden realization and develops a plan for the debtors to receive him, putting themselves under obligation to him. His ultimate goal is to secure another home after being cast out of his current one. This parable underscores the consequences of dishonesty and highlights the significance of choosing the path of honesty for comfort and peace.
